level.heading: CERTIFICATE OF OCCUPANCY REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN EXEMPT STATUS (ยง 9-323)

level.text: In order for real property to qualify for or maintain its exempt status under ยง 322, a certificate of occupancy (unless not required under 11 DCMR ยง 3203) shall be on file with the Deputy Chief Financial Officer.
The Deputy Chief Financial Officer may preliminarily accept a copy of an application for a certificate of occupancy to be supplemented by the awarded certificate of occupancy, once issued.
The certificate of occupancy evidences the legal use of the real property for the exempt purpose.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Regulation No. 74-35 effective December 12, 1974, 21 DCR 1643 (January 20, 1975), 16 DCR ยง 135; as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 48 DCR 11705 (December 28, 2001).
